Package io.sf.carte.doc.style.css

This package and its subpackages provide an implementation of the CSS Object Model API. The root css package essentially contains interface definitions (many derived from W3C) and generic classes.

Extended W3C CSSOM and SAC interfaces

There are two flavors of extended W3C interfaces in this library (those that extend previously existing W3C types, as opposed to those that are new ones):

  • Interfaces suffixed with a "2" (like CSSPrimitiveValue2) have new methods that -in the opinion of the author- are required to handle current CSS.
  • Interfaces that are prefixed with "Extended" offer additional functionality that you may or may not want to use.

Compliance with CSS specification(s)

Although this implementation attempts to follow the various CSS specifications, there are known deviations from what was specified by the W3C. Most of those differences arise from the fact that the W3C specifications are intended to be implemented by user agents, and not by tools like this library. One example is serialization.

Serialization and getCssText()

The CSSOM specification requires getCssText() to return the serialization of property declarations, following an algorithm that -whenever possible- builds shorthand properties from the longhands. However, this is inconvenient for most use cases of this library, so the getCssText() method returns the properties in a form that is close to what was specified with setCssText(), either longhands or shorthands.

The reason should be obvious: this library is generally not the final recipient for those declarations, but just middleware. If a CSS author specifies style in a certain way, he/she may be targeting more that one browser, but if this library produced its own shorthand constructions (and it has the logic to do that), that could break what was intended by the author. The library does remove obviously wrong declarations (and also redundant ones), however. The final result may not exactly reflect what was specified by the author, but is a good compromise.

Another deviation from the specification comes with the computed styles. Instead of returning the empty string (as the Working Group recommends), or a serialization of all the property name/value pairs known to the library (like some browser does), only those values that come from the cascade or are inherited from another element are included in both the item collection and getCssText(). Note that getPropertyCSSValue(String) and getPropertyValue(String) both return values for properties that are not included in the item collection, although this may seem counter-intuitive.

This approach has better flexibility for the different use cases of this library, and prevents potential problems (for example a downstream application not understanding all the properties in the declaration text, or re-parsing texts that are too large). Also, downstream users can check whether some declared style ended up in an element's computed style (as opposed to originating from initial values) by just checking CSSStyleDeclaration.getLength().

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AlgebraicExpression
    Expression sub-interface to be implemented by operations like sum or product.
    BoxValues
    Interface giving access to the computed box values.
    BoxValues.TableBoxValues
    Sub-interface for tables in the simple box model.
    CSSAttrValue
    attr() primitive value.
    CSSComputedProperties
    Interface that allows the retrieval of the primitive, "computed" values of CSS properties.
    CSSConditionRule
    Represents all the "conditional" at-rules, which consist of a condition and a statement block.
    CSSCounterStyleRule
    Counter-style rule.
    CSSCountersValue
    A CSS counters() function.
    CSSCounterValue
    A CSS counter() function.
    CSSCustomPropertyValue
    A CSS custom property value ('variable').
    CSSDeclarationRule
    A CSS rule that contains style declarations.
    CSSDocument
    A CSS-enabled Document.
    CSSElement
    Essentially adds CSS-related methods to the DOM's Element interface.
    CSSEnvVariableValue
    A CSS environment variable value.
    CSSExpression
    Implemented by CSS expressions.
    CSSExpressionValue
    A primitive value containing an expression (like calc()).
    CSSFontFeatureValuesMap
    Based on W3C's CSSFontFeatureValuesMap interface.
    CSSFontFeatureValuesRule
    @font-feature-values rule.
    CSSFunctionValue
    A function value.
    CSSGradientValue
    A gradient value.
    CSSGroupingRule
    Represents an at-rule that contains other rules nested inside itself.
    CSSKeyframeRule
    The CSSKeyframeRule interface represents the style rule for a single key.
    CSSKeyframesRule
    CSSKeyframesRule represents a complete set of keyframes for a single animation.
    CSSMarginRule
    Margin rule.
    CSSNamespaceRule
    Namespace rule.
    CSSNode
    A node that is related to a CSSDocument.
    CSSOperandExpression
    Sub-interface to be implemented by individual operands.
    CSSPrimitiveValue2
    Adds new methods and assigned units to W3C's CSSPrimitiveValue.
    CSSRatioValue
    The ratio value type is a number followed by optional whitespace, followed by a solidus ('/'), followed by optional whitespace, followed by a number.
    CSSShorthandValue
    Shorthand value.
    CSSStyleSheetFactory
    CSS style sheet factory.
    CSSStyleSheetList<T extends ExtendedCSSRule>
    List of extended style sheets.
    CSSSupportsRule
    Represents a ‘@supports’ rule.
    CSSUnicodeRangeValue
    A CSS unicode range value.
    CSSUnicodeRangeValue.CSSUnicodeValue
    A CSS unicode character value.
    DocumentCSSStyleSheet
    A style sheet that is able to take the responsibility to compute the styles associated to document elements.
    ErrorHandler
    Handle CSS errors at the CSSDocument.
    ExtendedCSSFontFaceRule
    An extended CSS font-face rule.
    ExtendedCSSMediaRule
    An extended CSS @media rule.
    ExtendedCSSPageRule
    An extended CSS @page rule.
    ExtendedCSSPrimitiveValue
    Extends the CSSValue interface to provide a couple serialization methods.
    ExtendedCSSRule
    An extended CSS rule.
    ExtendedCSSRuleList<T extends ExtendedCSSRule>
    A rule list with additional utility methods.
    ExtendedCSSStyleDeclaration
    Extended CSS style declaration.
    ExtendedCSSStyleRule
    An extended CSS style rule.
    ExtendedCSSStyleSheet<R extends ExtendedCSSRule>
    A style sheet.
    ExtendedCSSValue
    Extends the CSSValue interface to provide a couple serialization methods, and extend Cloneable.
    ExtendedCSSValueList<E extends ExtendedCSSValue>
    Augmented CSSValueList interface.
    MediaQueryList
    Based on W3C's MediaQueryList interface.
    MediaQueryListListener
    Listen to changes in media queries.
    NodeStyleDeclaration
    This style declaration belongs to a DOM node.
    RGBAColor
    Adds an alpha channel to W3C's RGBColor interface.
    SACErrorHandler
    High-level handling of SAC errors and warnings.
    SelectorMatcher
    CSS Selector matcher.
    SheetErrorHandler
    Handle CSS errors at the style sheet level.
    StyleDatabase
    CSS Style database.
    StyleDeclarationErrorHandler
    Handles the errors found in style declarations.
    StyleFormattingContext
    Define methods for style text formatting.
    StyleFormattingFactory
    Create formatting context objects for use with a style sheet factory.
    SupportsCondition
    CSS supports rule conditions.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    SACParserFactory
    SAC Parser Factory used by static methods.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CSSDocument.ComplianceMode
    The style computations operate under a compliance mode.
    CSSExpression.AlgebraicPart
    Enumeration of expression parts (operations, operands).
    CSSGradientValue.GradientType
    Enumeration of gradient types.
    RGBAColor.ColorSpace
    Enumeration of color spaces.
    SupportsCondition.ConditionType  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CSSMediaException
    CSS media Exception.
    CSSStyleException
    CSS topmost generic Exception.
    StyleDatabaseRequiredException
    Thrown when a requested operation requires a StyleDatabase to complete.
